snippet: The company had expected a profit at the beginning of its fiscal year, but its PC sales fell after the announcement that it would exit the business.
abstract: Sony slashes profit estimates for the third time in a year, warning investors that it is set to post a 130 billion yen, or $1.3 billion, loss in year ending in May; growing losses add to pressure on chief executive Kazuo Hirai to show that he can still engineer a turnaround.
lead_paragraph: The company had expected a profit at the beginning of its fiscal year, but its PC sales fell after the announcement that it would exit the business.

headline.main: Its PC Sales Tailing Off, Sony Now Expects Loss
